info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 8:55PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Thunderstorms and heavy rainfall in and around the Detroit metro area this evening... At 852 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms along a line from near Rochester to near Milford to near Dixboro to near Manchester and extending west toward Brighton. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall. Wind gusts around 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized street and road flooding. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Novi around 900 PM EDT. Sterling Heights, Northville and West Bloomfield around 910 PM EDT. Ann Arbor and Clinton around 915 PM EDT. Canton and Macomb Township around 920 PM EDT. Livonia, Mount Clemens and Saline around 925 PM EDT. Birmingham around 935 PM EDT. Southfield, Romulus and Milan around 940 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Anchorville, Franklin, Keego Harbor, Melvindale, Gibraltar, Waterford, Plainfield, Hudson Mills Metropark, Shelby Township and Commerce. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
